Jean-Claude Van Jam

Jean-Claude Van Jam was a 48 hour event that brought together game designers, artist and programers to create games inspired by Jean-Claude Van Damme’s expansive filmography.

I produced the game jam in collaboration with Kaho Abe, Ben Johnson, Matt Parker and Ramsey Nasser as joint project of Babycastles and the Eyebeam Game Research Group.

Teams were formed and assigned a JCVD movie at random to use as inspiration. The 9 teams created everything from custom physical interfaces to a dating simulation! Check out footage of the judging and awards here. Judges included Kaita Takahashi, Greg Trefry, Eric Zimmerman and Kaho Abe. The jam was generously hosted by the Eye Beam Art and Technology Center.
